Literature Review: The human gut microbiome is a complex ecosystem comprising trillions of microorganisms that play a crucial role in maintaining human health. However, the vast majority of these species are not genetically tractable, hindering our ability to interrogate their functions and manipulate them for therapeutic purposes. In this review, we will discuss the hurdles to genetic control of the human gut microbiome and report on the current state of genetic systems under development.
